result.execSummary:
The defendant Russell J. Stone was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Russell J. Stone is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Russell J. Stone was found guilty of Resisting or Obstructing an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Russell J. Stone

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Shaun's check came back - he had stopped in week prior - has PO box  - contactded defendant and Mr Daniels phone is broke and requested Russel come bick up check - sealed in envelope and Russell will pick up today

02:58 pm - Defendant Russell J. Stone in court with attorney Michael John Rielly.  Steven Mitchell Michlig appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  State moves to dismiss Count 1 - Granted.  Defendant pleads no contest to Count 2.  Plea questionnaire filed.    Court reads on waiver of rights and tendering plea. Waiver free and voluntary. Court finds that a factual basis for the plea exists and finds defendant guilty.  Michlig/Rielly/Defendant/Court statement to sentencing.
Court Sentence
Court Costs/DNA Surcharge
DNA Sample
Jail 30 days w/Huber for all purposes - Jail credit 13 days - To commence on/before 8-21-2015 @ 4pm
Appeal rights given
The court informs defendant of right to request expungement of the DNA under Wis. Stat. 165.77(4).
States Reply to Discovery  and State's Demand for Discovery

04:04 pm - Defendant Russell J. Stone in court with attorney Michael John Rielly.  Michael William Schiek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Rielly states an offer has been made - under serious consideration - requests one more adjournment.  Bail continued.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for July 7, 2015 at 02:30 pm.

01:56 pm - Defendant Russell J. Stone in court with attorney Michael John Rielly.  Steven Mitchell Michlig appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  In receipt of complaint, waive reading - not guilty plea.  Rielly/Michlig statement/motion to modify bond.  Currently set at $1,000 cash - Requesting sig bond.  Court denies motion.  
Bail continued  Pre-trial conference scheduled for May 5, 2015 at 03:30 pm.

02:21 pm - Defendant Russell J. Stone in court, via video, in custody.  Steven Mitchell Michlig appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  In receipt of complaint, right to counsel - defendant will contact PD,  Michlig statement to bail - Court sets $ cash bond.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for April 17, 2015 at 01:15 pm.
